sourceOrganization.name: NIAID Systems Biology
sourceOrganization.description: The NIAID/Division of Microbiology and Infectious Diseases (DMID) Systems Biology Consortium for Infectious Diseases is a group of interdisciplinary scientists that bridge disparate scientific disciplines including microbiology, immunology, infectious diseases, microbiome, mathematics, physics, bioinformatics, computational biology, machine learning, statistical methods, and mathematical modeling. For more information, visit the NIAID program page: https://www.niaid.nih.gov/research/systems-biology-consortium
alternateName: NIAID/DMID Systems Biology Consortium for Infectious Diseases
